intro: Aeollanthus ndorensis, commonly known as the Ndore sandmat, is a flowering plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in regions with seasonal rainfall, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
